data.title: Bangalore Metro Maps And Routes
data.meta_description: Prestige Raintree Park is located close to Whitefield metro station in Purpleline metro. It connects the city's eastern and western parts, starting from Whitefield in the East and ending in Challagatta in the west. Bangalore Metro routes currently run on 2 lines that are, Purple and Green, in Phase I.
data.text:
Prestige Raintree Park's Nearest Metro Station is Whitefield Metro Station. Whitefield Metro Station has excellent connectivity to all parts of Bangalore. Near Prestige Raintree Park, there is an elevated road to connect the Whitefield metro station. Whitefield (Kadugodi) to Challaghatta Metro Route is called as Purple Line metro. The Bangalore Metro is also known as the Namma Metro line owned by BMRC and connects with 51 stations.

The Purple Line is part of the Namma Metro rail system in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. It is 43.49 km long, with 37 stations from Challaghatta in the southwest to Whitefield (Kadugodi) in the east. The line has 31 elevated stations, 5 underground stations, and 1 at-grade station, passing through key activity centers, including Whitefield, Krishnarajapura, MG Road, Vidhana Soudha, and Majestic Station, which is an interchange station between the Purple and Green Lines. Phase I of the Purple Line was the first underground metro section in South India.

Bangalore Metro, known as Namma Metro (âOur Metroâ in Kannada), serves the city of Bangalore, India's IT capital, in 2 lines. Currently, only Phase 1 of the metro network is operational, while Phase 2 is being built, and Phase 3 is being planned. The network covers 42.3 km and has 51 stations. Every day, over 5 lakh people use the Bangalore Metro. The trains get electricity from a third rail that carries a direct current of 750 volts. The trains run every 5 to 15 minutes at speeds just under 80 km/h. The metro system has trains with 6 coaches that travel on the ground, as well as above and below it.

The Bangalore metro provides rapid transit services across the city. It helps to reduce traffic congestion and improve urban mobility. The metro system includes both elevated and underground tracks. It is designed to offer a fast, reliable, and efficient mode of transportation for everyday commuters.

Bangalore Metro Maps and Routes run on 6 different lines connecting each zone.

These Namma Metro Lines routes are:

Purple Line - The first Namma Metro line to start in Bangalore was the Purple Line. It began under Phase 1 and has 37 stations with 4 interchanges. The Purple Line also has Bangalore's first underground metro station. The line operates from Whitefield to Challaghatta station.

Green Line - The Green Metro Line is the second Namma Metro route in Bangalore. It runs through 29 stations and is 31 kilometers long. The line starts from Nagasandra and ends at Silk Institute.

Yellow Line - The upcoming Yellow Line will connect Rashtreeya Vidyalaya Road to Bommasandra, covering over 18 km. It will have 16 stations and will soon extend to Hosur.

Blue Line - The Blue Line will be the first Bangalore Metro line to connect Kasturi Nagar to the airport. It will cover 58.19 km and have 30 stations.

Pink Line - The Pink Metro Line will connect from Nagawara to Gottigerre in South Bangalore. It will have 18 stations, with some being underground.

Orange Line - The Orange Line will be developed in Phase 3 of the Namma metro. It will connect Phase 2A and Phase 3A at one station. This new line is expected to be operational by 2028-29.

Some of the facts about the Bangalore/Namma Metro Line are

Token fares for single one-way trips range from a minimum of Rs. 10 to a maximum of Rs. 50.

The 1st Metro Line started in 2011, and its construction began in 2007.

The Yellow and Purple line is set to Launch in 2024 and 2025.

The BMRC (Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd.)
